page.title: 03ASHWELLTHORPE PARISH&VILLAGE
page.content: The parish is partly woodland,& mainly 4 arable farms on some of which many acres of striking acid yellow oilseed rape are grown for making margarine. Old farm buildings of tarred clay lump or red brick & red pantiles exist alongside modern steel structures cov- ered with asbestos.The sewered village with treatment works is mainly a con- centrated linear{settlement of 180 {dwellings}on both sides of a busy B-class main road.Many residents work in Norwich.{The self-employed in the {village include a hairdresser,piano {dealer,nurseryman,general shopkeeper, {dairyman,garage owner,hotel keeper, {guesthouse keeper,2 builders,2 elect- {ricians,2 publicans.}Skeleton bus ser- vices Norwich/Wymondham.Mobile library monthly.2 wet fish deliveries weekly. Fish & Chip van.Bread delivery.Daily newspapers.Sunday newspapers.
